But there is no such feature in vscode yet.
It would be good if user could use keyboard in explorer.

data.title: Toggling word wrap resets the view position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open minified file and leave scrollTop = 0.
2. Focus on the top line, toggle 'disable wrapping for this file' button, so that it becomes unwrapped.
3. Toggle the button again to wrap it.
4. Scroll is reset to the bottom of the file.

Expectation: to keep focus on the top line.

data.title: SCM: Support only URI for iconPath
data.body:
@jrieken 

>Tho what we could consider is to always use the `Uri` for the path. I know it's sort of legacy that the editor decoration api supports both and there was ambiguity if strings mean url or file path (see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12111#issuecomment-249868088)

data.title: Allow setting for bash config
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I often use the builtin terminal pane in VSCode. When using bash (bin/bash) with default macOS configuration from .bash_profile it will not be loaded by code. VSCode expects a .bashrc in the home directory. It would be nice if we can configure the bash conf path. At the moment I work around this by having a bashconf file and symlinking this to .bash_profile and .bashrc. But I think a preference for the configuration file would be a better solution. 

I still need .bash_profile because it is used by the macOS terminal application.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open VSCode and hit _ctrl+<_ (german keyboard) to open bash (default in linux and macOS)
2. no configuration loaded, a blank bash if no configuration was added to .bashrc

data.title: Update SCM API based on feedback
data.body:
Some feedback from testers:

- The way a provider should return resources and notify Code of changes in that collection isn't intuitive.
- `contextKey` isn't a common API concept.
- There shouldn't be any requirement to provide URI for resources and resource groups. Everything should just work. Especially commands that are contextual to resources and resource groups.

Notable changes:

- `SCMProvider` renamed to `SourceControl`
- `SCMResourceGroup` renamed to `SourceControlResourceGroup`
- `SCMResource` renamed to `SourceControlResourceState`
- `sourceUri` renamed to `resourceUri`
- Instead of `scm.registerSCMProvider`, api users should use `scm.createSourceControl`. From then on, `sourceControl.createResourceGroup`. And then `resourceGroup.resourceStates = [state1,state2,state3].
- Commands located in menus which are contextual to a resource(s) will receive that resource(s) as arguments automagically, instead of `Uri` instances.
- Where you'd have to optionally specify a `contextKey` before, you now must specify an `id`.

data.title: Sort IntelliSense matches by score
data.body:
Today, the IntelliSense box is sorted alphabetically and then the "most relevant" item is reveal and pre-selected. After making IntelliSense matching more fuzzy I suggest to now sort by relevance because that makes items matching better appear closer to your cursor. 

A good sample is https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23581#issuecomment-290170757. Because the new fuzzy logic matches more items, some with higher relevance are not showing in the view port because alphabetical sorting pushes them down.

data.title: Expose a setting to disable JSDoc autocompletion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS

**Problem:**
February 2017 (1.10) update introduced [auto JSDoc comments](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_10#_auto-jsdoc-comments). Sometimes this automatic behavior is undesired and hitting `Esc` to cancel template expansion before `Enter` is inconvenient.

**Desired solution:**
Expose a new setting in the `TypeScript` group that allows to disable `_typeScript.tryCompleteJsDoc` command so in result code is expanding comment block without JSDoc keywords.

data.title: showInputBox should have the ability to have an array of quickpick options as well
data.body:
If you do showInputBox, you can receive input from a user.

If you do showQuickPick you can have the user choose from a list.

There is no way to receive input from a user AND show a list of choices.

If you try this with showQuickPick, and the user enters something that is not in the array, undefined is returned.

I think that showInputBox should have an overload that displays options just like in showQuickPick and returns the value instead of undefined if it is not an entry from the array.

data.title: Expand/customize git output

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
By default git doesn't show much when pushing, but if I send something to stdout/stderr in the [custom hooks](https://git-scm.com/docs/githooks) (on the remote, via ``echo`` for example) it will be sent back to local (to me), prefixed with "remote: ".

Like for instance in this example below push generates a lot garbage output (so no wonder you turned it off), but the selected text is my custom ``post-receive`` hook reporting back that it succeeded in deploying the project. Otherwise it would report an error and it is important for me to see it.
![](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=0B-OJBofmehO3eXlxMzZlSjhOOFk)
Standard git solutions as well as third party ones like SmartGit do show this stuff. I understand why VSCode filtering it out and neither do I want to see useless info. So maybe something like the [problem-matching in tasks](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_defining-a-problem-matcher) can be implemented here as well? Something that would enable filtering and/or reformatting of the output.

I mean, whats the point in VSCode's git output anyway, when the only thing it does is [spamming "git fetch"](https://drive.google.com/uc?id=0B-OJBofmehO3b3JsbFhYMDVKN2c) all the time while useful info gets devnulled...

Thank you.

data.title: 0.11.0-Insiders regression: C++ #define without a value breaks colorization

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.11.0-Insiders
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use this code in a .c/.cpp file::
#ifndef _UCRT
#define _UCRT
#endif

Bug: The colorization is broken by the #define without a value. It's a regression from 0.10.2.

The atom/language-c people say they aren't able to repro it on 0.57.0 and they think it's a bug with VS Code itself: https://github.com/atom/language-c/issues/218. I can't tell what version VS Code is using because the OSSREADME.json has the wrong version number of 0.51.3 in it, which is the same version number as VS Code 0.10.2.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19859882/24482265/d6fe80bc-14a4-11e7-9891-1b3e4340fb14.png)

data.title: #elif is not handled correctly by the C/C++ syntax highlighting
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:

Paste the snipped below in a C/C++ source file:

#if 0
int x;
#elif 1
int y;
#else
int z;
#endif

Note the broken highlighting - the #elif block should be "active". See the attached screenshot

![screenshot from 2017-03-29 17 03 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13824553/24481862/2bc9ae44-14a2-11e7-80cd-c102d3696c47.png)

data.title: Debug: Launch VSC configuration fails - remove runtime argument works
data.body:
Development Environment:

OS: Windows 7 Professional SP1 (VM under OSX)
Python: ActiveState 2.7.5

Visual Studio 15 Community \ C++ Tools \ SDK 8.1
VS Code: 1.10.2
VS Code Insiders 1.11.0 3-29-17
Chrome Debugger Extension 2.7.0

Problem:

When compiling and debugging VSC with stable or latest Insiders
Launch VSC and new compound launch and attach failed to Launch
code. Error is timeout connecting to run time via legacy protocol

Workaround:

If $(workspaceRoot) is removed from the runtime args for the
Launch VSC configuration the runtime will launch.

		{
			"type": "chrome",
			"request": "launch",
			"name": "Launch VS Code",
			"windows": {
				"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts/code.bat"
			},
			"osx": {
				"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts/code.sh"
			},
			"linux": {
				"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts/code.sh"
			},
			"urlFilter": "*index.html*",
			"runtimeArgs": [
				"${workspaceRoot}", // cleidigh - must remove to successfully launch
				"--debug=5875"
			],
			"webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"
		}

data.title: Cursor up/down jumps visually left/right when using a proportional font

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Same underlying issue as https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2654
Make a document with two lines; one filled with "WWWWW" and other line filled with "iiiiiii". Press the down arrow key, and the cursor will jump left and right, because the cursor position is counted in characters instead of pixels.

data.title: SCM: Active provider change event does not fire
update & alert is broken
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.10.2
Commit 8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331
Date 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. When there is an update available, click "Download Now"
2. When the popup is gone, click "Help" then click "Check for updates..."
3. Two popups are opened: "There are no updates currently available" and "There is an update available" as the image below.
4. Click "Release Notes" and an error message pops up.

![vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1012457/24478076/e8b7f8aa-14af-11e7-8cb6-d74022f88f28.png)
